sentences.en: And New Yorkers pride themselves on quick quip or a biting sarcastic remark.
sentences.cn: 纽约人也很自豪能够妙语如珠或出言挑衅的讽刺.

sentences.en: My advice is to ride it out, make an occasional smart - aleck quip.
sentences.cn: 我的意见就是出去旅行, 并时不时地说些自作聪明的俏皮话.

sentences.en: So, when do I start? A slightly obnoxious quip. Don't invite yourself into the job.
sentences.cn: 那我什么时候上班? 问得妙,但有点儿招人讨厌. 不要不请自来.

sentences.en: The commentators make endless quips about the players' appearance.
sentences.cn: 解说员们对球员们的外貌没完没了地说着俏皮话。

sentences.en: To quip means to say something that is intend to be amusing or clever.
sentences.cn: Quip的意思是,说一些可能令人惊讶或者看起来很聪明的话.

trans.tran_cn: 俏皮话，妙语，嘲弄，讥讽，双关语
trans.tran_en: A quip is a remark that is intended be amusing or clever

trans.tran_cn: 说俏皮话，嘲弄，讥讽，托辞
